'Whiteman Air Force Base (AFB)' is a United States Air Force base located
approximately south of Knob Noster, Missouri; east-southeast of Kansas
City, Missouri.

The host unit at Whiteman AFB is the '[[509th Bomb Wing]] (509 BW)', assigned to
the Eighth Air Force of the Air Force Global Strike Command . The 509 BW
operates the B-2 Spirit Stealth Bomber, designed to be employed to strike high-
value targets that are either out of range of conventional aircraft or
considered to be too heavily defended for conventional aircraft to strike
without a high risk of loss.

Whiteman AFB was established in 1942 as 'Sedalia Glider Base'.
